---
title: Orders
sidebar:
  order: 3
slug: shopify/account/orders
---

## Last Order

This is the last order made by your customer, is a simple div block that will create a place where the last order info can be added. Just add a div with the following attribute:

<custom-attribute name="account" value="last-order"></custom-attribute>

Inside this div you can add all elements that you find inside the section [**Order Elements**](/shopify/account/orders#order-elements)

<copy-element name="Last Order Example"></copy-element>

## Orders

This are the order mades by your customer, is a simple div block that will create a place where the order info can be added. This div placeholder will be duplicated once for each order made by your customer. Just add a div with the following attribute:

<custom-attribute name="account" value="orders"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Orders Example"></copy-element>


Inside this div you can add all elements that you find inside the section [**Order Elements**](/shopify/account/orders#order-elements)



## Order Elements

These elements below can be added only within one of the 2 elements documented before.

### Number

This is the number of the order, like #33 it can be added on any text/link elements with the attribute:

<custom-attribute name="order" value="number"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Order Number"></copy-element>

### Created At

Returns the date of when an order was created. It can be used on text elements using the attribute:

<custom-attribute name="order" value="created-at"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Created At"></copy-element>

### Cancelled

This is a conditional specific for the order, the element where you add the following custom attribute will be showed only if the order was cancelled

<custom-attribute name="order" value="cancelled"></custom-attribute>


### Cancelled At


Returns the date of when an order was cancelled. It can be used on text elements using the attribute:

<custom-attribute name="order" value="cancelled-at"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Cancelled At"></copy-element>

### Cancel Reason

Returns one of the following cancellation reasons, if an order was canceled:
items unavailable
fraudulent order
customer changed/cancelled order

it can be used on any text element using the attribute:

<custom-attribute name="order" value="cancel-reason"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Cancel Reason"></copy-element>

### Total

Returns the total price of an order. It can be used on any text element using the attribute:

<custom-attribute name="order" value="total"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Order Total"></copy-element>


### Subtotal

Returns the subtotal price of an order. It can be used on any text element using the attribute:

<custom-attribute name="order" value="subtotal"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Order Subtotal"></copy-element>


### Shipping

Returns the shipping price of an order. It can be used on any text element using the attribute:

<custom-attribute name="order" value="shipping"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Order Shipping"></copy-element>

### Fullfillment Status

Returns the fulfillment status of an order (like unfulfilled, fulfilled). It can be used on any text element using the attribute:

<custom-attribute name="order" value="fulfillment-status"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Fulfillment status"></copy-element>

### Financial Status

Returns the financial status of an order (like pending payment, paid). It can be used on any text element using the attribute:

<custom-attribute name="order" value="financial-status"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Financial Status"></copy-element>


### Url

Returns a unique URL that the customer can use to access the order, it can be used on any link elements with the attribute:

<custom-attribute name="order" value="url"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Url"></copy-element>

### Status Url

Returns the link to the order status page for this order, it can be used on any link elements with the attribute:

<custom-attribute name="order" value="status-url"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Status Url"></copy-element>


### Notes

Returns the note associated with a customer order. It can be used on any text element, using the custom attribute:

<custom-attribute name="order" value="note"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Order notes"></copy-element>
